name: cerebral
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
medical
  specialized relating to the brain or the cerebrum: He suffered a cerebral haemorrhage. The patients frequently had a history of disease leading to cerebral damage.
formal demanding or involving careful thinking and mental effort rather than feelings: She makes cerebral films that deal with important social issues. Chess is cerebral; video games are visceral.
formal intelligent and serious, and enjoying serious thought rather than emotion: His problem wasn't his policies; it was his personality. He was simply too cerebral and too out of touch with Middle America.
